Karl Wright wrote:
> Hi,
> 
> Heritrix 1.5 runs out of memory for us when we have about 1700 domains. 
>     The admin UI also seems to have a limit where (at some point) you 
> get an error if you save a job that has too many seeds.
> 
> We are trying to decide whether to migrate to 1.8, and this would be a 
> key reason to do it.  Can somebody there describe what sorts of changes 
> were made to 1.8 to address the two problems above, and what the new 
> limits are?

I echo what Stack said: the 1.6 and 1.8 releases both have improvements 
in memory behavior, compared to a 1.5.x from-CVS version.

The UI limit preventing the editting of large seed lists hasn't changed 
recently. You should, however, be able to edit the seeds file on disk, 
and then upon changing any other setting, the list will be reprocessed 
(as long as the scope's 'reread-seeds-on-config' setting is the default 
'true').

A better system for handling large numbers of seeds -- both in the UI 
and behind-the-scenes -- is a priority for the next release.

- Gordon @ IA
